Class CIT2_Rulebase

CIT2.CIT2_Rulebase

extends java.lang.Object

      Builds a CIT2 rulebase with 0 rules

  • Method Details

    • addRule

      public boolean addRule​(CIT2_Rule current_rule)
      Adds a rule to the rulebase
      Parameters:
      current_rule - The rule to be added to the rulebase
      Returns:
      true if the collection has changed (as specified by Collection.add()), false otherwise

    • getRules

      public java.util.ArrayList<CIT2_Rule> getRules()

    • fromT1Rulebase

      public static CIT2_Rulebase fromT1Rulebase​(type1.system.T1_Rulebase t1_rulebase, double displacement_as_uod_percentage)
      Builds a CIT2 rulebase starting from a T1 one. They have the same rules but each T1 is used as a generator set to build the corresponding CIT2 set
      Parameters:
      t1_rulebase - The rulebase to start from
      displacement_as_uod_percentage - Size of the displacement set in terms of the percentage of the UOD
      Returns:
      The CIT2 rulebase built using the T1 sets in t1_rulebase as generator sets

    • toIT2

      public intervalType2.system.IT2_Rulebase toIT2()
      Converts the current rulebase to an equivalent IT2 one (i.e. the IT2 sets involved have the same FOU as the CIT2 sets in the current rulebase)
      Returns:
      The equivalent IT2 Rulebase

    • explainableDefuzzification

      public ExplainableCentroid explainableDefuzzification​(int discretization)
      Runs the inference with the switch index approach and produces an explanation for the endpoints
      Parameters:
      discretization - Discretization step to use to defuzzify the T1 AES
      Returns:
      The interval centroid and the explanation for its endpoints

    • doSwitchIndexDefuzzification

      private ExplainableCentroid doSwitchIndexDefuzzification​(int discretization, boolean buildExplanation)
      Runs the inference and defuzzifies the output using the switch index approach. If buildExplanation is true, also produces an explanation that shows which rules generated the endpoints of the interval centroid
      Parameters:
      discretization - The discretization level to use
      buildExplanation - Whether or not the explanation structure must be provided
      Returns:
      The interval centroid with an explanation or a CentroidExplanation with only the interval centroid value if no explanation was requested

    • buildExplanation

      private ExplainableCentroid buildExplanation​(generic.Tuple centroid_value, CIT2[] consequent_mfs, java.util.HashMap<CIT2,​Pair<generic.Tuple,​Pair<CIT2_Rule,​CIT2_Rule>>> firing_intervals, int left_switch_index, int right_switch_index, type1.sets.T1MF_Interface min_aes, type1.sets.T1MF_Interface max_aes, generic.Output output)
      Builds the explanation for the centroid value given as an input. The explanation shows the rules that contributed to the generation of the endpoints of the centroid
      Parameters:
      centroid_value - The centroid value for which an explanation must be built
      consequent_mfs - The array with all the consequent membership functions in the rulebase
      firing_intervals - The firing intervals with the consequent membership functions they refer to
      left_switch_index - The switch index that determines the left endpoint of the interval centroid
      right_switch_index - The switch index that determines the right endpoint of the interval centroid
      min_aes - The AES that determines the left endpoint of the interval centroid
      max_aes - The AES that determines the right endpoint of the interval centroid
      output - The output variable this centroid refers to
      Returns:
      A CentroidExplanation containing the explanation for centroid_value

    • switchIndexDefuzzification

      public generic.Tuple switchIndexDefuzzification​(int discretization)
      Computes the interval centroid using the switch index approach
      Parameters:
      discretization - The discretization level to use
      Returns:
      The interval centroid as a Tuple

    • inferenceOnConsequentAES

      private type1.sets.T1MF_Interface inferenceOnConsequentAES​(boolean isLeftEndpoint, int curr_switch_index, int current_index, CIT2 set, generic.Tuple truncations)
      Applies the inference operator (implemented using the minimum operator) to an AES of a consequent CIT2 membership function
      Parameters:
      isLeftEndpoint - States whether this function has been used in the generation of the left endpoint of the interval centroid
      curr_switch_index - The current switch index value
      current_index - The index of set
      set - The CIT2 consequent membership function to which the inference operator will be applied
      truncations - The truncation interval given by the firing of a rule
      Returns:
      An AES of set to which the inference operator has been applied

    • samplingDefuzzification

      public generic.Tuple samplingDefuzzification​(int samples)
      Determines the defuzzified interval centroid using the sampling technique. samples number of instances of the CIT2 system are created: in each one each of the CIT2 sets involved is substituted with one of its AES, generating a T1 rulebase. The minimum and maximum centroid values obtained among all the samples determine the left and right endpoints of the final interval centroid given as an output
      Parameters:
      samples - Number of samples to produce
      Returns:
      The interval centroid obtained through the sampling technique

    • getSampledRulebase

      private type1.system.T1_Rulebase getSampledRulebase()
      Samples a T1 rulebase from the current CIT2 one. The sample is obtained by replacing each of the CIT2 in the rulebase with one of its AES chosen randomly
      Returns:
      The sampled T1 rulebase

    • getExplainableFiringIntervals

      private java.util.HashMap<CIT2,​Pair<generic.Tuple,​Pair<CIT2_Rule,​CIT2_Rule>>> getExplainableFiringIntervals()
      Maps each CIT2 consequent set to the rules that generate their maximum firing interval, i.e. the rules that generate the highest left and right endpoints of the firing interval
      Returns:
      A Map pairing each consequent CIT2 FS to the rules that generated the LB and UB of the firing strength for the set

    • getFiredFOU

      public intervalType2.sets.IntervalT2MF_Interface getFiredFOU()
      Computes the fired FOU (i.e. the FOU of the fuzzy output) of the current rulebase
      Returns:
      The IT2 FS representing the fired FOU

    • plotSystem

      public void plotSystem()
      Plots the variables (input and output ones) involved in the system. For each variable, the membership functions partitioning it are shown

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Builds a printable String showing the rules in the rulebase. For each rule the toString() method is invoked to build the final output String
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      The String showing the rules in the rulebase
